page.title: 17ECOLOGY (BIRDS)
page.content: BECAUSE OUR AREA IS A RURAL ONE THERE ARE ALWAYS NUMEROUS BIRDS TO BE SEEN. BESIDES HAVING FIELDS, WOODS, AND HEDGEROWS THERE ARE ALSO HOUSES SO THE AREA ATTRACTS A VARIETY OF BIRDS THAT THRIVE IN DIFFERING ENVIRONMENTS. ON A JUNE DAY A GROUP OF US SAW THE FOLLOWING BIRDS WHILE STANDING IN THE SCHOOL GROUNDS: PIDGEON, CROW, ROOK, JACKDAW, BLACKBIRD, THRUSH, ROBIN, CHAFFINCH, BULLFINCH, SPARROW, DUNNOCK AND SWALLOW (THIS BIRD HAD A NEST UNDER THE EAVES OF THE SCHOOL ROOF). BESIDES SEEING THESE COMMON BIRDS FROM THE SCHOOL GROUNDS, WHEN WE WALKED IN DIFFERENT PARTS OF OUR BLOCK, WE SAW GREEN WOODPECKERS, KESTRELS, SWIFTS, HOUSE MARTINS, WRENS, WILD DUCKS AND GEESE, SWANS AND COOTS (THESE WATER BIRDS WERE ON THE VILLAGE POND). WE'VE NOTICED A LARGE INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF JAYS IN THE AREA THIS YEAR.
